text:
NO. 24 -0395 
NO. ___ SW3d ___, 04 -10-24  
NO. 322 -744263 -23 & NO. 322 -744538 -23 
 Morgan Michelle Myers v Charles Dustin Myers
NOTICE 
Proceedings arising from the 322nd District Court
-&- 
O
n Petition for Writ of Mandamus from the Second Court of 
Appeals, 
Ta
rrant County, Texas  
-&- 
In the
 Supreme Court of Texas, 
Austin.  322-744263-23FILED
TARRANT COUNTY
10/9/2024 4:21 PM
THOMAS A. WILDER
DISTRICT CLERK

NO. 322-744263 -23 
IN THE 322ND DISTRICT COURT OF TARRANT COUNTY , TEXAS  
 
 
 
NOTICE  
 
 
 
 Respondent  submits this notice in good faith regarding the joint motion for recusal 
filed on October 7, 2024. Continuous procedural abnormalities continue to occur without 
explanation, which raises  further questions regarding the integrity of this case  in the 
current venue .  
Given the severity of the situation involving the Respondent and his family,  
particularly hi s children, th is noti ce poin ts out the following concerning abnormalities : 
I. DISCREPANCIES IN FILING 
 1. The Respondent filed his Joint Motion for Recusal with the court on October 7, 
2024, but it has yet to be docketed on the reSearchTX platform. The file, which was 
tabbed, indexed, and hyperlinked for convenience, had a size of 19.3 MB at the time of 
submission. The Respondent received a receipt confirming acceptance of the filing on 
October 7, 2024, at 10:46 a.m. (Exhibit A).  IN THE MATTER  
OF THE MARRIAGE OF  
MORGAN MICHELLE MYERS  
AND CHARLES DUSTIN MYERS  
 
AND IN THE INTEREST OF MARA 
MYERS AND CAROLINE MYERS, 
CHILDREN

https://texas.tylertech.cloud/ViewDocuments.aspx?FID=c1b3b3a7 -7024 -4fa9-a8e1-
95094f9ecc6b  
 2. On October 8, 2024, the Respondent received an email from the Court 
Coordinator, Ms. Lindsey Baker, confirming Judge James Munford’s decision to refer the 
case to the Regional Presiding Judge, David Evans. The email included an Order of 
Referral, signed by Judge Munford on October 8, 2024 (Exhibit B) . 
 3. Upon reviewing the email, the Respond

source_pdf: CASE DOCS\CHARLES DUSTIN MYERS\10.09.24 - NOTICE DISCREPANCIES-1.pdf
text:
er the 
case to the Regional Presiding Judge, David Evans. The email included an Order of 
Referral, signed by Judge Munford on October 8, 2024 (Exhibit B) . 
 3. Upon reviewing the email, the Respondent noticed that the attached Motion to 
Recuse  was missing crucial elements, specifically the affidavit and accompanying 
exhibits. Additionally, the tabs and hyperlinks were no longer present. The Respondent 
raised these discrepancies with Ms. Baker, who confirmed that the motion had been filed 
with the exhibits, despite the Respondent not receiving any indication of this in the receipt provided. 
 4. Dissatisfied with the response, the Respondent pointed out that the file size of 
the motion submitted on October 7, 2024, and the one sent via email differed 
significantly. It appeared that an unverified and modified version of the motion had been 
forwarde d to Judge Evans (Exhibit B). 
5. On the morning of October 9, 2024, the Respondent received the Order of 
Referral and correspondence to Judge Evans at 10:39 a.m., which still contained the 
same discrepancies noted earlier (Exhibits C and D) .

6. At 12:17 p.m. on the same day, Ms. Baker sent further correspondence stating:  
“Attached is correspondence from Judge Munford to Judge Evans and an 
Amended Order of Referral.  
Due to the length of the Joint Motion to Recusal, it is being sent as three 
attachments . Thank you. ” Exhibit E  
  
Despite this explanation, the Amended Order of Referral has not been filed on the 
reSearchTX platform, raising additional concerns regarding the handling of the original motion. The reasoning provided for splitting the motion into three attachments only arose 
after the file size discrepancy was highlighted, and there is still no confirmation that the 
correct version of the motion was forwarded to Judge Evans or exists within the official 
case file.  
II. THE RESEARCH TX PLATFORM  
7. The reasoning given by Ms. Baker regarding the file size raises further 
questions. Accor

source_pdf: CASE DOCS\CHARLES DUSTIN MYERS\10.09.24 - NOTICE DISCREPANCIES-1.pdf
text:
ion was forwarded to Judge Evans or exists within the official 
case file.  
II. THE RESEARCH TX PLATFORM  
7. The reasoning given by Ms. Baker regarding the file size raises further 
questions. According to the District Clerk’s e -filing frequently asked questions (FAQs), 
attached as Exhibit F , the following guidelines are provided : 
Q: Do you want all exhibits uploaded as separate documents or merged into one 
document? 
A: Merged into one document.  
   
Q: Should any exhibits be submitted as attachments to petition or as 
separate filing?

A: Exhibits should be merged into the lead document for a single filing. 
  
Q: Exhibits – Are these uploaded as attachments to the petition. If yes, do you 
want them uploaded singly or do you want all the exhibits combined into a single 
document? 
A: Preference is to have exhibits as part of the lead document they are filing, 
as long as they don't exceed the 35mb per envelope size limit. Lead 
documents get file -marked; attachments do not get file marked.  
 
The Respondent’s original motion complied with these guidelines, as the total file size 
was well below the 35 MB limit. However, despite this, the court opted to split the 
document into three parts. Additionally, the docket still shows that neither the ori ginal 
motion to recuse nor the subsequent correspondence or amended order from Judge Munford have been properly filed or docketed.  
8. Pursuant to the Texas Rules of Civil Procedure, as amended by Misc. Docket 
No. 13- 9165  from the Texas Supreme Court,  
“[e]very pleading, plea, motion, or application to the court for an order, whether in the 
form of a motion, plea, or other form of request, unless presented during a hearing or 
trial, must be filed with the clerk of the court in writing, must state the grounds  therefor, 
must set forth the relief or order sought, and at the same time a true copy must be served 
on all other parties, and must be noted on the docket.” TEX. R. CIV . P. 21a

9. Given that a

source_pdf: CASE DOCS\CHARLES DUSTIN MYERS\10.09.24 - NOTICE DISCREPANCIES-1.pdf
text:
ds  therefor, 
must set forth the relief or order sought, and at the same time a true copy must be served 
on all other parties, and must be noted on the docket.” TEX. R. CIV . P. 21a

9. Given that a true copy of the Amended Order of Referral has not been filed or 
docketed as required by Rule 21a, and in light of the contradictions between the court 
coordinator’s explanation and the FAQs, the Respondent respectfully raises these 
concerns. The Respondent further requests clarification from the Court regarding the 
purpose of modifying the document in a manner that causes it to appear as an unverified 
pleading , which is fatal to the motion. See TEX. R. CIV . P. 18a(a)(1). 
CONCLUSION  
The Respondent respectfully requests that the Court take immediate corrective 
action to ensure that all filings, including the Amended Order of Referral, are properly docketed in accordance with Rule 21a and that all parties, including the Respondent, have  
full and equal access to the court’s records and filings. The Respondent remains 
committed to complying with all applicable rules and procedures and looks forward to 
the Court's timely resolution of these issues  to pre serve the faith and integrity of the 
judiciary.  
 
  Respectfully submitted, 
    /s/ Charles Dustin Myers  
    CHARLES DUSTIN MYERS 
     Chuckdustin12@gmail.com   
     817-507-6562 
     Pro-se

To: "Lindsey K. Baker" <LKBaker@tarrantcountytx.gov>
Dear Ms. Baker,
Thank you for your response, and would just ask for some clarification on a couple of things.
There are noticable discrepancies between the file I submitted, accepted and available on the reSearchTX platform versus
what appears in the court's receipt to the Regional Judge. My original submission was 20.21 MB, while the version in the
courts email is 423 KB. Additionally, my receipt provides no indication that the exhibits were filed alongside the motion,
particularly the affidavit, which is referenced in the table of contents.
The document I submitted was also hyperlinked, but those links are missing in the court’s receipt.
Could you please clarify which court system the file is currently in and explain for what purpose the file was modified to
appear as if it were an unverified motion? 
I would appreciate your prompt attention to this matter at your earliest convenience.
Best regards,
Charles Myers
Chuckdustin12@gmail.com

tcounty.com

General Questions   
Is Amex accepted?  Yes  
Is your Case Management Syst em integrated with the EfileTexas system? Yes  
Are attachments allowed? Yes, but prefer only proposed orders that are not exhibits submitted as attachments.  Any 
other kind of attachment should be merged into the lead filing document.   
If so, do you want them as separate attachments, or combined into a single document? Combined into a single 
document, except proposed orders that are not exhibits.  
Are multiple lead documents allowed in one filing? (For example, a petition and two motions on the same case – 
can that be done in a single filing?) Yes - Multiple filings allowed in one envelope as long as they pertain to one 
case.  However, pleadings requiring fees should be separate lead documents within that one envelope.  
Initial Filings 
Do you want all exhibits uploaded as separate documents or merged into one document?  
Merged into one document   
Should any exhibits be submitted as attachments to petition or as separate filing? Exhibits 
should be merged into the lead document for a single filing.     
Are citation requests, copies, etc., under Optional services or as a Filing Code for a separate 
filing? Citations or other service documents request would be under the filing codes, but 
copies are under optional services.  
If Citation Request form is requi red, from where can it be downloaded? 
http://web64.tarrantcounty.com/content/dam/main/district -
clerk/efile_service_request_form.pdf   
When request ing citations, etc. do you allow filer to request copies (optional services) to 
attach to the citation? Yes  
Do you require plaintiff or defendant addresses? Yes

When doing an original petition filing, should all parties be listed or just first plaintiff /f

source_pdf: CASE DOCS\CHARLES DUSTIN MYERS\10.09.24 - NOTICE DISCREPANCIES-1.pdf
text:
tional services) to 
attach to the citation? Yes  
Do you require plaintiff or defendant addresses? Yes

When doing an original petition filing, should all parties be listed or just first plaintiff /first 
defendant?  All parties   
    
  
Subsequent Filings    
Additional Questions  
  Do Notices, Orders, etc., that should not be file stamped have to have a cover letter as the 
lead document -  Yes   
Do you accept non -indexed case filings? Yes - Preference would be for them to be indexed 
for the Judge to follow.  
What process should be used for eFiling proposed orders? If a motion is being filed with it 
then it can be submitted as an attachment to the motion.  If not and is only being 
submitted by  itself, then pick proposed orders with a cover letter as the lead and attach 
the order.  
What process should be used for eFiling motions? The filer would look for their filing 
motion on the pick list. If the pick list does not have their specific motion t hen they 
should select the “generic” Motion (other types)  
What process should be used for eFiling exhibits ? Same process for exhibit as initial 
filings - Exhibits should be merged into one document with the lead document.   
  
  
  
Do attorneys have to 
go through an 
Electronic Filing Service 
Provider  
(EFSP)?  Yes, but you are not limited to one EFSP        
Will there be a guest 
E-filing station/kiosk in 
the Courthouse?  Guest E -filing stations with scanners are located in District Clerk's Office at the Tim Curry 
Justice Center, 3rd floor,  401 W. Belknap and at the Family Law Center, Records area 3rd 
floor,  200 E. Weatherford, Ft Worth, TX.  
Do attorneys have to 
pay an extra fe e to use 
a guest E -filing 
station?  No, The District Clerk will not charge an additional fee to use the guest e -filing station.  
Will the filer be able to 
send E -filings 24/7?  Yes  
Can an attorney send 
multiple pleadings in 
one transmission for 
one transmission fee?  Multiple pleadings can be sent in one

source_pdf: CASE DOCS\CHARLES DUSTIN MYERS\10.09.24 - NOTICE DISCREPANCIES-1.pdf
text:
iling station.  
Will the filer be able to 
send E -filings 24/7?  Yes  
Can an attorney send 
multiple pleadings in 
one transmission for 
one transmission fee?  Multiple pleadings can be sent in one envelope as long as all of the pleadings are in the same 
case number and don't exceed the 35mb per envelope size limit. Each separa te document 
needing to be file marked must be submitted as a lead document.

If an attorney does not 
select the correct fees, 
or only selects one 
fee, but selected multiple filings that 
require fees will this 
be rejected?  
for copies through certified payments. Note-  a convenience fee charged to your credit card 
will be added for this option.     
Yes  Is an email address 
required to be included 
on filings   Yes  
Filing TRO's or  
Protective Orders - 
Family Law  Couple of options: 1) Attorneys can take their applications and orders straight to the Judge to 
be filed and signed.  It is mandatory that you immediately deliver the originals  
(pleading/order) to the Clerk of the Court so that the Clerk retains the origi nals and it can be 
entered into JIMS.  or  2)  E -file the application/motion - (after knowing what court the case is 
assigned) go to that Court Clerk to get the docket sheet and then go to the Court with your 
proposed order.  Once the order is signed the at torney will bring back the docket sheet and 
order to the Court clerk to be processed.     
Filing TRO's or  
Protective Orders - Civil 
Law  Couple of options: 1) If you choose to process the TRO in person, you should e -file the 
pleading and bring in your pro posed order.  2) -  If you choose to E -file everything, submit 
your pleading as a lead document and your proposed order as an attachment.  The clerks will 
print out and send to the court; once the order is signed the clerk will email you the signed 
order fo r you to process accordingly.  
The temporary 
exparte order needs 
to be signed on the 
same day as the filing 
of the application. 
What i

The temporary 
exparte order needs 
to be signed on the 
same day as the filing 
of the application. 
What if the Judge is 
not available 
how/who will get that 
order to another 
Judge if the attorneys 
have to e -file the 
temporary Ex parte 
order?  The only thing that has changed, since e -filing has been mandated, is the pleading must be 
efiled and all other processes after the filing remain the same.   NOTICE - Use caution when 
"pre paying" for a TRO notice, just i n case the Judge will not sign the order. The refund 
process is time consuming.  
How will petitions be 
served if service is 
needed in Tarrant 
County?  Refer to the Tarrant County Service request form on the District Clerk Web e -filing 
information link. Th e form must be completed, printed, scanned, and e -filed as a PDF.    
Will the attorney still 
have to provide service 
copies?  There are four options for services copies 1) - pay for service copies when selecting your 
service document. 2) Attorneys can provide copies of the "accepted” file -marked document 
in person or through a runner.  3) - Pay for service copies in person at the file desk or 4) pay

Will there be any 
exceptions or special 
circumstances where 
attorneys would be 
allowed to file by 
paper?   Please refer to Misc. Docket 13 -9165 - TRCP - 21(f) (4).   
Exhibits – Are these 
uploaded as 
attachments to the 
petition. If yes, do you 
want them uploaded 
singly or do you want 
all the exhibits 
combined into a 
single document?  Preference is to have exhibits as part of the lead document they are filing, as long as they 
don't exceed the 35mb per envelope size limit.  Lead documents get file -marked; 
attachments do not get file marked.  
    
Do you allow the eFiling  
of proposed orders?  Yes, proposed Orders can be e -filed.

motion with orders, are 
both the motion and

What cannot be efiled?  Refer to Misc. Docket No. 13 -9165 - TRCP 21(f) (4).  
If my filing is rejected 
will I still be charged 
any fees?  No, but your bank may place a hold on your funds for up to 14 business days.

can I just resubmit the 
missing pages?  No, the clerk will be unable to modify the original image in any way.  You will need to 
resubmit the whole document correctly.
